description: Number of orbits of length n under the map whose periodic points are counted by A005809.
comments: The sequence A005809 records the number of points of period n under a map. The number of orbits of length n for this map gives the sequence above.a(n) is divisible by n (cf. A268617), 2*a(n) is divisible by n^2 (cf. A268618).
references: Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
links: Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
example: a(3) = 27 since a map whose periodic points are counted by A005809 has 3 fixed points and 84 points of period 3, hence 27 orbits of length 3.
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Mar 13 2001
